meanings.definition: Treat with excessive care or attention.
meanings.sent1: She babied her injured puppy, making sure it had everything it needed to heal.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy woman babied her pet dog, buying it gourmet treats and luxurious toys.
meanings.sent3: He babied his car, washing it every day and never letting anyone else drive it.
meanings.sent4: The teacher babied her favorite student, always giving him special treatment and extra help.
meanings.sent5: The gardener babied the delicate flowers, watering them gently and protecting them from harsh weather.

meanings.sent1: After a long week, she decided to baby herself with a relaxing spa day.
meanings.sent2: The grandparents loved to baby their grandchildren, showering them with gifts and treats.
meanings.sent3: He would baby himself with ice cream whenever he felt sad or stressed.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity was constantly babied by his entourage, fulfilling his every whim.
meanings.sent5: The hotel staff babied the VIP guest, ensuring his stay was as luxurious as possible.

meanings.definition: To treat someone as a baby.
meanings.sent1: She would baby her younger sister, always helping her with everything and never letting her do things on her own.
meanings.sent2: The overprotective mother tended to baby her teenage son, making decisions for him and not allowing him to take risks.
meanings.sent3: He would baby his best friend, always worrying about his well-being and trying to solve all his problems.
meanings.sent4: The boss tended to baby his employees, micromanaging every aspect of their work.
meanings.sent5: The nurse would baby her patients, ensuring they were comfortable and well-cared for at all times.
